God is no longer the center of the universe, but man. Skepticism and logical thinking born. An era of major intellectual and technological advances...

But also the era of Spanish Inquisition, major trials against witchcraft, the great schisms and heresies, ecclesiastical corruption and political and social chaos. Superficially, the man begins to forget the Devil. But ... will the Devil forget the men?

This Supplement includes rules for playing Aquelarre during the years 1450 to 1600. It also contains historical references, new characters, the characteristics of witches and wizards of the time, many ideas for adventure, six short adventures and a ready to play campaign set in African lands called Affer Surst. Rinascita Aquelarre is a supplement for Aquelarre, the demonic medieval roleplaying game and can not be played without it.

This book is a supplement for Aquelarre, the demonic medieval roleplaying game and can not be played without it."

From the back of the book.

____________________________________________________________________

"Rinascita. Renacimiento. Movimiento surgido en Italia que se expande por toda Europa: tiempo de florecimiento intelectual: las artes, las letras, la filosofía. Se desarrolla el pensamiento crítico. Dios ya no es el centro del universo, sino el Hombre. Nacen el escepticismo y el pensamiento lógico. Época de importantes avances técnicos e intelectuales...

Pero también época de la Inquisición Española, de los grandes procesos contra la brujería, de los grandes cismas y herejías, de corrupción eclesiástica y de caos político y social. Superficialmente, los hombre empiezan a olvidar al Diablo. Pero... ¿olvidará el Diablo a los hombres?

Este Suplemento incluye reglas para jugar a AQUELARRE durante los años 1450 a 1600. Además contiene referencias históricas, nuevos personajes, las características de brujas y magos de la época, numerosas ideas de aventuras, seis aventuras cortas listas para jugar y una Campaña en tierras africanas llamada Affer Surst.

Rinascita es un suplemento para AQUELARRE, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval, y no puede jugarse independientemente sin éste."

Extraído de la contraportada del libro.

52705.name: Way of the Staff
52705.description:
This volume collects all the spellcasting races, classes, and feats from Monte Cook's Arcana Unearthed variant player’s handbook. Use them to enhance your own d20 System games. You can use everything in this book alongside the 3rd Edition or revised 3rd Edition Player’s Handbook.

Loresongs, sprytes, mojh, and verrik. Akashics, greenbonds, magisters, runethanes, and witches. These are the followers of the Way of the Staff. This 51-page book will expand your available roleplaying options dramatically.

Here’s what you’ll find inside:
• Chapter One: Races:
Four all-new races. Some of them have special racial level progressions you can take like classes to gain unique racial abilities. Most start out as viable 1st-level characters, either with traditional classes or racial levels.
• Chapter Two: Classes:
Five brand-new core classes. Balanced to work together, they cover all the traditional spellcaster “roles” you enjoy in a fantasy game, but in a very different way
• Chapter Three: Feats and Talents:
In addition to traditional magic-related feats, this chapter offers two new types: the talent, which you can choose only at the start of the game, and the ceremonial feat, which you can take after performing certain rituals.

52706.name: Dracs
52706.description:
"Dragons. We are accustomed to the image of dragons through the representations created by numerous cultures throughout the world. According the people of different places, the dragon can be, alternatively, a synonym of courage, a power symbol or a solar cycle allegory. They are found in the coat of arms, on flags and popular fables. Sometimes they are intriguing and clever, others are faithful companion and ally. Always appears exultant of grandeur and power, and possessing some hidden wisdom, forbidden to humans.

In Catalonia, however, the most usual is to find the image of the "Drac", the dragon, fighting with a paladin who will win, if the dragon is not already dying at his feet. And in Catalonia, the dragon represents the enemy, the evil, the devil in person. He is an evil spirit and better do not make any deals or alliances with him. He expires or destroy us. In these pages you will find many kinds of DRAGONS. None, I fear, is like players are guessing.

Dracs is the first regional Aquelarre supplement, and is dedicated to Catalonia. Here you will find all the information needed to better set your stories in Catalonia: historical information on the geography, society and political tensions of the time, a bestiary of creatures indigenous, traditions and customs of ancient magic, popular legends applicable to the game, shorter adventures and a campaign set in the eastern Mediterranean, Despertaferro, as well as a detailed description of Barcelona city at the time.

Dracs Aquelarre is a supplement for Aquelarre, the demonic medieval roleplaying game and can not be played without it."

From the back of the book.

______________________________________________________________

"Dragones. Estamos acostumbrados a la imagen de los DRAGONES gracias a las representaciones que de dicha criatura han realizado numerosas culturas en todo el mundo. Según el pueblo que lo imagine, el DRAGÓN puede ser, alternativamente, sinónimo de valentía, símbolo de poder o alegoría del ciclo solar. Los encontramos en los escudos nobiliarios, en las banderas y en las fábulas populares. A veces es intrigante y astuto, otras es aliado y compañero fiel. Siempre se nos aparece exultante de grandeza y poderío, y en posesión de cierta sabiduría oculta, vedada a los humanos.

En Cataluña, sin embargo, es muy difícil encontrar una imagen del "Drac", el DRAGÓN, en la que no esté luchando contra el paladín que lo va a vencer, si no es que está ya agonizante a sus pies. Y es que en Cataluña, el DRAGÓN representa al enemigo, al maligno, al Diablo en persona. Y es un espíritu del mal con el que no se hacen tratos ni se establecen alianzas. Se le vence o nos destruye. En estas páginas los jugadores encontrarán muchas clases de DRAGONES. Ninguno, me temo, es como imaginan.

Dracs es el primer suplemento regional de AQUELARRE, y está dedicado a Cataluña. En él se encontrará todo la información necesaria para mejor ambientar sus partidas en tierras catalanas: información histórica sobre la geografía, la sociedad y las tensiones políticas de la época, un Bestiario de criaturas autóctonas, tradiciones y costumbres seculares de carácter mágico, numerosas leyendas populares aplicables al juego, un buen número de aventuras cortas y una campaña ambientada en el mediterráneo oriental, Despertaferro, así como una detallada descripción de la ciudad de Barcelona en la época Bajo Medieval.

Dracs es un suplemento de AQUELARRE, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval, y no puede jugarse independientemente sin éste."

Extraído de la contraportada del libro.

52707.name: Gamma World Player's Handbook
rpgissuearticle: Critical Mass - Game World d20 Players Handbook
52707.description:
From back of book:

"Up From the Ruins

The Final Wars destroyed civilization. Competing forces battle for control of the shattered remains, using everything from strong fists and cold steel to the most advanced science of the old world and mysterious new powers of the mind.

The Gamma World Player's Handbook presents a new edition of the classic sci-fi adventure game, energized for the 21st century! Play humans, mutants and new races created in the chaos of the Final Wars, out not just to survive but to thrive in the midst of adventure, danger, and mystery.

Requires the use of the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game or Dungeons and Dragons Player's Handbook, Version 3.5, published by Wizards of the Coast, Inc.

The Gamma World campaign setting is published under license with Wizards of the Coast and is 100% compatible with d20 rules."

52708.name: Grimoire
52708.description:
From the back cover:

This volume collects all the new spells and the magic rules from Monte Cook's Arcana Unearthed variant player’s handbook. Use them to enhance your own d20 System games. You can use everything in this book alongside the 3rd Edition or revised 3rd Edition Player’s Handbook.

Magic is fluid and subject to the whims of the individual caster, thus it remains always mysterious and fascinating. This 93-page book will expand your available spellcasting options dramatically. Here’s what you’ll find inside:

• Chapter One: Magic:
Anyone who’s a little tired of the traditional “prepare, then cast” method of handling spells will love the ability to alter a spell’s power and weave together minor spells into larger ones. Also, spell templates let you customize spells to fit your character.
• Chapter Two: Spells:
This book offers dozens of pages of new spells, each complete with guidelines for heightening and diminishing its effects and for creating a magic item from it.

52709.name: Rincón
52709.description:
"RINCÓN, a place in the world. Tell me, good friend, tell me how things are going in the Lordship of Rincón. Are old legends of the Estañedo castle still becoming a reality? Are bandits still lurking in lonely roads? Do we know already what secrets awaits behind the walls of San Gabriel Abbey? Is still the forest a refuge and fortress of the terrible Mandrakes? Is the Old Man alive yet? What's happening in the valley during the night of San Juan? Tell me, good friend, tell me without fear. Tell me, what are the news of Rincón dominion.

Rincón is an Aquelarre supplement dedicated to the rural world, and the main character is a small rural valley in a place not specified of the Iberian Peninsula during the second half of the fourteenth century. In this book, the reader will find information about life and customs of the peasants of the time, about how create characters, about the economics and social customs, and new adventures set in the domain of Rincon, a campaign set in Salamanca and a complete solo game: Mercaderes, that recreates the lives of artisans and merchants of the era.

Rincón is a supplement for Aquelarre, the demonic medieval roleplaying game and can not be played without it."

From the back of the book.

________________________________________________________

"RINCÓN, un lugar en el mundo. Dime, buen amigo, dime cómo van las cosas en el señorío de Rincón. ¿Siguen haciéndose realidad las viejas leyendas del castillo de Estañedo? ¿Aún acechan los bandidos los caminos solitarios? ¿Se sabe ya qué secretos aguardan los muros de la Abadía de San Gabriel? ¿Todavía es el bosque refugio y fortaleza de las terribles Mandrágoras? ¿Vive aún el viejo señor? ¿Qué pasa en el fondo del valle, durante las noches de San Juan? Dime, buen amigo, dime sin temor. Dime, qué nuevas tienes del señorío de Rincón.

Rincón es un suplemento de Aquelarre dedicado al mundo rural, y que tiene como protagonista un pequeño valle campesino en un lugar no determinado de la península ibérica durante la segunda mitrad del siglo XIV. En este libro el lector podrá encontrar información sobre la vida y costumbres de los campesinos de la época, nuevas reglas de creación de Pj, sobre la economía y las costumbres sociales, así como nueve aventuras ambientadas en el señorío de Rincón, una campaña ambientada en Salamanca y un juego completo en solitario: Mercaderes, que sin abandonar el ambiente de Aquelarre recrea la vida de los artesanos y comerciantes de la época.

RINCÓN es un suplemento para Aquelarre, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval, y no puede jugarse de manera independiente."

Extraído de la contraportada del libro.

52710.name: Noctum
52710.description:
From the publisher:
We summoned it with our malice. We made it grow by the strength of our hatred. We let it stay because we can’t change our very natures. Nothing can force humans to commit acts of evil, only endow us with powers to indulge in our own sadistic proclivities. It’s all around us, on every news channel and in every paper. The vile nature of man is evident. Some of us kill our parents and forsake our children, greed is our creed and instant gratification our pastime.

There is no God; there is no heaven or hell. There is only the ancient darkness and the evil of man. Hope is fleeting and grace is no longer in our grasp. We gave the darkness a form and a realm of its own. It wishes to feed upon us but now some parts of it want more. Humankind has taught it to relish in the suffering of others in a way only humans can. Enter Noctum, an inner tale of survival horror. There is nothing more evil than your fellow man.

52711.description: Cute little duck and the frog boy are swimming around the pond, trying to reach a large rock. If you throw a dice right color, you'll go to the next leaf. The first one to reach big rock wins. This can also be used as a memory game. Easy and fun to play the smallest family!
52711.name: Eläinystävät lammella

52712.name: GURPS WWII: All The King's Men
52712.description:
"The British Empire's Finest Hour"

User summary:

A complete description of the British armed forces in World War II. Covers this history from the horrors of World War I through VE Day (neglecting the last few months until VJ Day).

Contains templates for British characters, descriptions of the armed forces themselves, the equipment used, and the major campaigns.

52713.description: Animal themed memory game where the players are looking for a farm animal parts. Gather the animals line up in front of you - the winner is the one who has the longest line when all the animals have been found. A draw occurs Samu Frog will help you to victory! Easy and fun memory game youngest family!
52713.name: Eläinystävät maalla

52714.name: DM's Screen and Player's Guide
52714.description:
From the back cover:

The perfect companion to Monte Cook's Arcana Unearthed rulebook for
players and DMs! This is more than just a game aid featuring cool artwork and lots of charts—the 32-page supplement inside offers character sheets and conversion information to help you use Arcana Unearthed with standard d20 System products.

This accessory contains a three-paneled horizontal screen with stunning artwork plus all the charts a DM needs to run the game. A separate double-sized reference card features player charts.

The enclosed 32-page book offers:
• 11 illustrated character sheets—one for each new class in Arcana Unearthed;
• Conversion guidelines for importing 3rd Edition and Revised 3rd Edition (version 3.5) classes, spells, and other rules into this compatible system;
• And lots of character concepts and archetypes to get you started creating PCs and NPCs!

52715.name: Top Ballista
52715.description:
From the back of the book:

Blue Fox, scramble ... Red Dragon at 5 o'clock!

The Realms of the Sky belongs to Serraine, the incredible Flying City of the gnomes. They know no borders, and fear no monsters. From the far reaches of Alphatia to the mysterious lands of Arypt, their neverending quest is for the magical fuel... that will keep them flying! Top Ballista describes the City of Serraine and its facetious inhabitants. You will learn to play gnomes, gremlins, pegataurs, nagpas, and other fantastic creatures as Player Characters. Join the famous Top Ballista flying squadron, and become and ace and a hero. Top Ballista is the second in the Creature Crucible series that completes the Gazetteer series. It is also fully adaptable to the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS 2nd Edition game.

Top Ballista includes:
A complete description of Serraine, its people and a large, color map of the city;
Seperate background and adventure booklets;
Complete rules on how to create and play skygnomes, gremlins, harpies, and others;
New rules on air combat, spellcasting, and magical items.

Look for PC1: Tall Tales of the Wee Folk, and coming soon PC3: The Sea People!

52716.name: Rhyme Bag
52716.description: Rhyme Bag could be used with in large group of children or just with one child. Rhyme Bag includes 24 rhyme cards. One side of the card there is a rhyme and on the other side there is a colourful picture matching the rhyme. Rhymes are new! Never published before. The more rhymes you get, the more points you earn!

52717.name: GURPS WWII: Dogfaces
52717.description:
"On the Front Lines in the Fight for Freedom"

User summary:

A complete description of the American armed forces and United States participation in World War II. Covers the history from the horrors of World War I through VJ Day.

Contains templates for American characters, descriptions of the armed forces themselves, the equipment used, and the major campaigns. Covers the homefront as well.

52718.name: Deluxe Dungeon Master's Screen
52718.description:
From the back of the package...

Keep Your Plans Secret and Your Game Moving

Behind this sturdy four-panel screen, you control all that takes place in the fantasy realms of your Dungeons & Dragons game. Featuring stunning new art, this invaluable game aid helps you guard your notes, die rolls, miniatures, and other surprises from your players' eyes. The new landscape format makes it easier for you to see the game in front of your screen while maximizing the space you have behind it.

Also included is a bonus four-panel screen geared toward the action-packed world of your d20 Modern campaign. Because both screens fully support the d20 System, they can be used separately or together by an experienced Dungeon Master or Gamemaster.

52719.name: The Jihad to Destroy Barney RPG and Writer's Guide
rpgitemversion: The Jihad To Destroy Barney RPG And Writer's Guide PDF Version
52719.description:
From the opening color text:

"So you want to really know what's going on? What if I were to tell you that our world is under attack from a demon lord and his allies, a race of extraterrestrial sorcerers? That this unholy alliance seeks to either make us their slaves or destroy us utterly?

"And that the demon lord himself leads the invasion under the benevolent guise of the childrens' TV host Barney the Dinosaur?"

The Jihad to Destroy Barney RPG And Writer's Guide is a fan-made supplement for GURPS 4th Edition describing a world in which a high demon is able to operate nearly openly in his quest to take over the world. Players play Jihaddi, those who have been made aware of the threat. The intended playstyle is a black comedy conspiracy, and the gamebook continually crosses the line between being serious roleplaying setting and parody of other dark conspiracy roleplaying settings.

52721.name: GURPS WWII: Iron Cross
52721.description:
"Nazi Germany and Its Forces"

User summary:

A complete description of the German armed forces in World War II. Covers German history from unification under Bismarck through the bitter end in 1945.

Contains templates for German characters, descriptions of the armed forces themselves, the equipment used, and the major campaigns. Covers the homefront as well. Includes a section on some of the speculative wonder weapons that might have turned the tide.

52723.name: Agone
52723.description:
From the back cover:

AGONE, an epic role-playing game in the Twilight Realms

At the dawn of time, the Muses breathed life and magic into Harmundia. Then the Masque came, a renegade set on putting all mortals under his yoke. The Eclipse darkened the sky and Twilight descended upon the world. Since then, the humans and the nine seasonling races have build the Twilight Realms. Now the enemies are more deceitful and more powerful than ever. The Masque has returned, and the evil Darken is creeping into the Realms. Once again, as the Eminences Grise foretold it, war is setting Harmundia ablaze!

Let the Drama begin!

Born in the wake of Agone of Roundrock, the Inspired have already led full lives and believe their hour of glory has come and gone. But fate has decided otherwise, for they carry the Flames of the Muses. As an Eminence Grise, the time has come for you to bring those inspired by the flame - lords, merchants, highwaymen and magicians - together to fight the enemy.

You are the last hope!

Discover a dark and baroque Heroic Fantasy world where weapons clash and spells thunder. In this setting of intrigues and marvels, be a baron respected by his subjects, a magical minstrel admired by all, an elusive acrobat assassin, or a Machiavellian spy. Learn to master the four Magical Arts and the Ascendancy, the magic of the Dancers. Play the part of a brawny ogre, a mysterious black fey, a hunting sprite, a plotting medusa, a wandering spriggan, a sturdy dwarf, a minotaur or an awe-inspiring giant!

Will you be able to protect your flame at all costs?

52724.name: Dungeon (Issue 41 - May 1993)
rpgissuearticle: It's Never Too Late to Say...
Old Man Katan and the Mushroom Band
Pleasing All of the People, Some of the Time
52724.description:
Volume VII number 5

Cover by Terry Dykstra

Issue quote:
"He that high growth on cedars did bestow,
Gave also lowly mushrooms leave to grow."
--Robert Southwell, Scorn Not the Least

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

52725.name: The Sea People
52725.description:
From the back cover:

...And you thought you knew everything about the good, old D&D® game world!

The Sea of Dread is home to not one, but several aquatic nations. There underneath the surface, lie mysterious caverns, submerged cities never explored by surface folk, shipwrecked remnants of historic naval battles, and countless frightening guardians of the deep. Discover the power of the kna, meet the kind people of smaar, and face the ultimate threat to the fabulous Realms of Undersea.

The Sea People is the third book in the Creature Crucible series that completes the Gazetteer line. It is also fully adaptable to the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS® 2nd Edition game.

The Sea People includes:

A complete description of the lands under the Sea of Dread, its people, and a large Gazetteer-style map of the submerged kingdoms;
Separate background and adventure booklets;
Complete rules on how to create and play Sea Elves, Tritons, Mermen, and other aquatic races;
New rules detailing underwater spell casting and magical items.




Don't miss PC1: Tall Tales of the Wee Folk or PC2: Top Ballista!

52726.name: GURPS WWII: Motor Pool
52726.description:
User summary:

Vehicles from World War II presented in form of the Modular Vehicle Design System (MVDS) presented in GURPS WW II. Covers everything from armored cars to aircraft carriers. From the mass-produced to the one-off prototype.

In total, over 100 vehicles are detailed for air, land and sea.

52727.name: Hyperconscious: Explorations in Psionics
52727.description:
From the back cover:

Dream is the gate, Mind the fuel, and Time an illusion...
The institution known as the Oraculus splinters, sundering the Seven Sages. Now, each lone sage decries the others as frauds and proclaims unique revelations of future eras —- a future that whispers back secrets of great power! Are these visions true, or are they insidious dreams?

Discover the latest imaginative adventure from the master of d20
psionics! During play, Hyperconscious: Explorations in Psionics unveils valuable game material, including new psionic prestige classes, powers, monsters, feats, and items—many based around the
themes of Dream. Plus, discover more about the horrifying entity
known as the Dark Plea and its latest machinations.

Hyperconscious also updates all the psionics rules material from
Malhavoc Press’ EN World Award-winning previous psionics books,
If Thoughts Could Kill and Mindscapes, to v. 3.5 of the d20 System.
This material is now fully compatible with the Expanded Psionics
Handbook—and Hyperconscious is the only place you can find the
updates and the new adventure all in one convenient volume.

52728.name: Character Sheets
52728.description:
From the back of the package

A Place For Everything.

No matter how unusual or powerful your DUNGEONS & DRAGONS character is, this complete set of character sheets lets you keep a record of everything that makes your character unique.
Includes:


Eleven double-sided single-class character sheets, one for each of the classes in the D&D Player's Handbook.



A double-sided sheet formulticlass characters.



A sheet for special creatures such as a wizard's or sorcerer's familiar, a paladin's mount, or a druid's animal companion.



Easy-to-follow instructions and a sample filled-out sheet.


Every page is designed to be easy to photocopy, so you never have to worry about having a fresh sheet handy when you need one.

52729.name: Das Land des Schwarzen Auges
52729.description:
Subtitled: "Werkzeuge des Meisters"

From the back of the box:

"'Das Land des Schwarzen Auges' focuses on one subject: Aventurien. The included books describe land, people, sirs, citizens and heroes in aventurien-scientific detail.

17 authors contributed to this encyclopedia every adventurer will be interested in: articles on important cities, law and order, astronomy, elven music, guard regiments and much more. On top of this you get the most thorough presentation of Gareth (capital city and imperial residence) right down to the innumerable temples and ministries.

'Das Land des Schwarzen' Auges makes Aventurien come alive and is essential for every demanding adventurer."

The box includes:

- Das Land des Schwarzen Auges, 128 pages
- Enzyklopaedia Aventurica, 120 pages
- colored map of Aventurien (A1)
- colored city map of Gareth (A2)
- some monochrome Gareth overviews

52730.name: Systems Failure
rpgissuearticle: Systems Failure - The Texas Lone Star Cavalry
52730.description:
From back of book:

"Systems Failure RPG
A Role-Playing Game of survival and heroics

Systems Failure is non-stop, blood and guts action! A story of loss, rebirth, and courage. Of self-sacrifice, patriotism, and heroics.
Characters are off-color, off-kilter and sometimes just plain crazy, but they are all heroes willing to take a stand.
American Civilization (and the world) has collapsed and is dominated by an inhuman foe from another world. it's time she was free again. A truly different and tantalizing spin on the Post Apocalyptic story setting, done with Palladium's no-holds-barred, anything goes approach to things.
- A complete role-playing game with everything you need to play (other than people and dice) in one book.
- 11 O.C.C.s including the Exterminator, Freebooter, Sawbones, Grease Monkey, NORAD Psychic, NORAD Splicer, and Wacko.
- Creation rules and colorful background material to make each character unique.
The monstrous enemy are bug-like alien invaders with the power to infiltrate and seize control of every electronic device on the planet.
- Plenty of maps, world information, and adventure ideas.
- Written by Bill Coffin with Kevin Siembieda.
- 144 pages.

52732.name: Suomi Tietopeli Matkaversio
52732.description: The game includes a total of 600 Finland concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

52734.name: GURPS WWII: Weird War II
52734.description:
"Secret Weapons and Twisted History"

User summary:

Things that might have been if things had just been a little different ... or really strange.

From the traditional "what if's" to ancient conspiracy theories to invaders from outer space, GURPS Weird War II explores all the possibilities. The possibilities are endless.

52735.name: Dungeon (Issue 1 - Sep 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Out of the dungeon, into the fire.
52735.description:
Volume I number 1

Cover by Keith Parkinson

Issue quote:
"Sorry! I don't want any adventures, thank you. Not today."
-- Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit, J.R.R. Tolkien

From the table of contents:
"DUNGEON Adventures is a new periodical from TSR, Inc. in which you, the readers, may share your own adventures and scenarios from AD&D and D&D gaming with the legions of other fantasy gamers. Each issue offers a number of fairly short (but often quite complicated and long-playing) modules, selected from the best we receive."

52737.name: Deluxe Character Sheets
52737.description:
From the back of the package...

Keep up with All of Your Characters

Inside the pockets of this protective folder, you'll find a full set of Dungeons & Dragons character sheets-and more. Formatted in a new folio-style layout, each record has plenty of room to keep track of everything that makes each of your characters unique, including extra space for adding new class features and abilities for your multiclass characters.

INCLUDES:
> Eleven four-page character sheets, one for each of the character classes
in the Player's Handbook.
> A four-page generic D&D character sheet.
> Quick-reference spell lists for all spellcasting classes in the Player's Handbook and spellcasting prestige
classes in the Dungeon Master's Guide.
> A bonus, four-page d20 MODERN character sheet.

Every character sheet and spell list is designed to be easy to photocopy, so you'll always have a fresh sheet on hand when you need one.

52739.name: Chaositech
52739.description:
From the Back Cover:

Law and Order Beware - Chaos Rules!

Chaos seethes with the primal forces of the universe. The strong can harness its power within strange devices unlike anything the world has ever seen: chaositech. This unique sourcebook from 3rd Edition co-designer Monte Cook introduces chaos-powered items that resemble both technology and magic, but are truly neither. Within these pages, discover the secrets of devices like the cohesion blaster, the darkness imbiber, and fleshworkers.

Chaositech also contains rules for chaos magic, including dozens of new spells, original skills, feats, and prestige classes. Topping it all off is a rundown of the major chaos cults, a collection of mutation rules, plus details on the chaosomaton, fused aberration, and other all-new chaotic monsters - including the Galchutt, the very Lords of Chaos themselves.

Much of the content of Chaositech comes directly from Monte's long-running home campaign. It's proven material ready to drop into any game. All the rules have been updated to v. 3.5 of the d20 System. Now you too can harness the wild power of chaos with this d20 sourcebook!

rpgitemversion: Priests of the Celestial Sun Soft Cover Version
52740.name: Priests of the Celestial Sun
52740.description:
From the back of the book:

Pilgrims on the Luminous Path

The nobles may rule the secular lives of the Known Worlders, but the Church guards their souls — and in so doing, dictates to the nobility. Few lords dare to defy the will of the Patriarch and his bishops. But the Church's rock is not as stable as it once was — new sects and orders have appeared in the wake of the Emperor Wars, shifting the populace's loyalties and reawakening ancient heresies. While the Church stands united against the nobles and guilds, they feud within their cathedrals, vying for dominion over the faithful.

Herein are detailed the lives of the saints, the histories and beliefs of the major sects of the Church, the heretical Incarnates and the religion of the Children of Zuran."

52742.name: GURPS Y2K
52742.description:
"The Countdown To Armageddon"

User summary:

A look at the Y2K hysteria, from the facts to the absurd. What has happened, what should or will happen and all that can go wrong. The conspiracy behind it all. Includes a brief look at millennial hysterics of the past (Y1K anyone?).

Written in 1999 before the world as we knew it came to an end.

52745.name: Necro-Groundhog of the Awfully Dark Graveyard of Excruciating, Arcane Death
52745.description:
From the back cover:
You were awfully proud of yourself when you strode into King Torg's chamber with the baby you snatched from Tabriz. There was a big party and you were the kobold of the hour. Unfortunately, fame, like a full belly, is fleeting and soon kobolds were stealing babies from all manner of ridiculously dangerous sites; the Never-ending Strawberry Fields, Iowa Jim's Temple of Foreboding, and Bob the God's Happy Fun Park just to name a few. Most of the kobolds who set out after these babies are never heard from again, but every once in a while one of them gets lucky... like what's his name, the guy who brought back the possessed baby. (Thems good eatin! Not that you know this from personal experience mind you but the look on King Torg's face when he gobbled it down was unmistakable!) OR SO YOU THOUGHT! Unfortunately, possessed babies are... well... possessed and there's a certain demon that's giving King Torg quite a toothache. Now it's up to you to find the only thing that can save him - The Toothpick of Exorcism!

This is a Solo Adventure for use with the Kobolds Ate My Baby! role-playing game. You will need a copy of Kobolds Ate My Baby!, some paper, a handful of dice and the ability to read. Along with the adventure you will find a map of the lands of the Necro-Groundhog for use with BLT! the official Kobolds Ate My Baby! collectable boardgame.

BATTLE EVIL UNDEAD RODENTS!

EXPERIENCE KOBOLD DENTISTRY!

MASH THE ONE-HEADED ETTIN!

BRAVE THE DREADED SWAMP OF BEAUTY!

52746.name: Mindscapes: A Psion's Guide
rpghonor: 2003 ENnie for Best Electronic Product - Silver Winner
52746.description:
From the back cover:

The Evolution of d20 Psionics!

This classbook for psionicists is just what you’ve been clamoring for! In response to reader requests, D&D® Psionics Handbook designer Bruce Cordell brings us Mindscapes: A Psion’s Guide. This book presents a dozen new prestige classes for psionic characters, as well as an
alternate psionic combat system and a wide variety of new feats, powers, and items.

This valuable resource for DMs and players alike serves as a companion piece to the Psionics Handbook and If Thoughts Could Kill, Bruce’s award-winning* psionics supplement from Malhavoc Press.

52747.name: Fangs
52747.description: A collection of pregenerated stats for Gloranthan creatures included in the second edition box set. It includes everything from major Gloranthan intellegent races to mounts and wild animals. It similar to Foes created by the same author.

52749.name: Block War
52749.description:
From the publisher's site:

What starts as a petty fight could degenerate to a full-scale war. When things are turning sour who said mediators had to be neutral?

A fixer hires the team for what seems like little more than a complicated prank. However, sometimes, people have a hard time keeping their vengeance proportionate. When two veterans of the business conflict enter the fray, the team needs to make some hard choices. In not time, things go from humorous to deadly. This 26-page scenario includes a complete adventure, player handouts, and record handling sheets for participating in the Shadowrun Missions (SRM) campaign.

52750.name: Foes
52750.description:
A collection of pregenerated statistics for Intelligent Glorthan races. It includes over 1200 individuals with individualised weapons, spells and equipment including familiars and mounts.

From the back of the book:
The world portrayed in the role-playing game RuneQuest is filled with dangerous and exotic life forms. Some are legendary, such as the manticore, griffin, or minotaur. Some are unique to Glorantha such as the Dragonewt, morokanth, or broos. Some are traditional, such as the troll, elf, or dwarf. Some are from myths, such as the awesom dragon, the wyrm, or the terrifying wyvern. Many are human, including varous types of barbarians, peasants, mercenaries, and adventurers.

This book, FOES, contains the statistical profiles of over 1200 such characters prepared for instant use by referees in hundreds of situations. Normal calculation of this many non-player-character statistics would take the average person more than 200 hours of work - yet FOES presents them at once, with variety, thought, and wit for less than 1 cent each.

52752.name: Burning Bridges
52752.description:
From the publisher's site:

The voice on the other end of the comm sounded desperate. The kind that pays well. Then he asked, "How much do you know about demolitions?"

Mr. Johnson is at the end of his rope, and he needs some serious income. He latches onto a desperate and tragically dangerous scheme that just might get him what he needs, though it might cost hundreds of lives in the process. The team needs to decide if the pay is worth the risk and the ethical quandary. This 27-page scenario includes a complete adventure, player handouts, and record handling sheets for participating in the Shadowrun Missions (SRM) campaign.

52753.name: Everyone's Your Friend
52753.description:
From the publisher's site:

Sometimes following up on a job really means following. You’ve been hired to track down an old acquaintance who’s fled across the continent.

In the first scenario of the New York City Shadowrun Missions campaign, characters are introduced to the challenges of running among the bright lights of Manhattan. Provisions allow characters who participated in the Denver campaign to transition their characters to this new location. This 25-page scenario includes a complete adventure, player handouts, and record handling sheets for participating in the Shadowrun Missions (SRM) campaign.

52754.name: Dungeon (Issue 26 - Nov 1990)
52754.description:
Volume V number 2

Cover by Scott Burdick

Issue quote:
"People could survive their natural trouble all right if it weren't for the trouble they make for themselves."
--Ogden Nash

52756.name: Ready, Set, Gogh!
52756.description:
From the publisher's site:

By 2070, life literally imitates art. Some people have a fetish for it and it’s your job to see that it’s delivered and still breathing.

The team is forced to confront the challenges of Manhattan security, when Mr. Johnson asks them to perform a major heist. From there, things spiral into a double helix of complexity as motivations are abruptly twisted. This 24-page scenario includes a complete adventure, player handouts, and record handling sheets for participating in the Shadowrun Missions (SRM) campaign.

52757.name: The Golden Age of Champions
52757.description:
From the back of the book:

"THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE FOR VICTORY"
-- General Douglas MacArthur

Join in the struggle to preserve the American Way of Life-relive the bygone days of the Second World War. Use your new powers, skills, vehicles, weapons, and victory war bonds to make the world safe for democracy.

This ready to play Champions supplement contains exciting new additions including sidekick rules, historic data, GM notes, and home front scenarios to extend your Champions campaign back to the beginning age of superheroes.

THE GOLDEN AGE OF CHAMPIONS

52758.name: Digital Grimoire
52758.description:
From the publisher's site:

Nobody Knows All Magic

Digital Grimoire is the Master’s Class of Magic - expanding on Street Magic, it details additional traditions, magical groups & threats, spirits, enchanting expansions, and a handful of new spells and adept powers.


Traditions: Egyptian, Rastafarian, Psionic
Magical Groups: Shrine of the Southern Winds, The Oxford Grand Lodge, Código 515
Magical Threats: Toxic Paths, Shadow Spirits, Insect Spirits


Digital Grimoire is 18 pages (including cover): a bite-sized expansion to Shadowrun, Fourth Edition and Street Magic.

52759.name: Imperial Encyclopedia
52759.description:
From Back Cover:

This book is a reference for both players and referees. It includes essays on the Imperium and other interstellar empires, descriptions of starships and vehicles in common use throughout known space, lists of equipment available on the open market and its prices, maps, and other information valuable to players and referees alike.

This book is part of a three-book set which provides the basic rules and background for playing the game.

User Summary:

Part of the MegaTraveller box set.

52760.name: Enemies
52760.description:
From the back of the book:

Complete your Champions campaign with over 35 dastardly villains!!! Each one with complete powers & skills!!! Every villain fully illustrated!!! All under one cover!!!

52761.name: Itras By
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Production - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Most Innovative Game - Runner-Up
52761.description:
From the back of the book:

Dette er ikke Itras By

Translated: "This is not Itra's City"

User Summary:

A Norwegian Roleplaying game set in a surreal 1920's inspired world.

52762.name: Dungeon (Issue 25 - Sep 1990)
52762.description:
Volume V number 1

Cover by John Blumen

Issue quote:
"Come, my friends,
'Tis not too late to seek a newer world.
Push off, and sitting well in order smite
The sounding furrows; for my purpose holds
To sail beyond the sunset..."
--Ulysses, Alfred, Lord Tennyson

52763.name: Fabula
52763.description:
From the back of the book:

Fabula er et fantasieggende spill du blir fullstendig hekta på; et spill som tar deg og vennene dine med til eventyrriket Orianna der dere - vips - forvandles til helter som må løse gåter, finne skatter, nedkjempe uhyrer og motstandere. Sørg for å ha god tid og en fredelig krok før dere legger ut på ferden. God reise!

English translation:

Fabula is a fantasy game you will become completely hooked on; a game which takes you and your friends to the fairykingdom of Orianna where you -flash- are transformed into heroes who must solve riddles, find treasures, fight monsters and assailants. Make sure you have lots of time and a peacefull corner before setting out on your journey. Bonne Voyage!

52764.name: Monkeywrench
52764.description:
Publisher blurb:

A little milk run like this should be no problem. Though, it sounds like you don’t get much time. Non-lethal rounds and no legal complications makes these "security consultant" gigs the best in the Big Apple.

Mr. Johnson wants someone to test his security systems. Everything should be perfectly routine and above board. After all, things never go horribly wrong during a shadowrun, right? No reason to have any back-up plans ready for this. It’s all just wonderfully straightforward. What’re you giving me that look for? This 25-page scenario includes a complete adventure, player handouts, and record handling sheets for participating in the Shadowrun Missions (SRM) campaign.

52765.name: Enemies II
52765.description:
From the back of the book:

JUST WHEN YOU THOUGHT IT WAS SAFE TO PLAY CHAMPIONS... ENEMIES II

From the Introduction;

Once again HERO GAMES brings you another volume of supervillains and other nasties for use with CHAMPIONS, the super hero role playing game. Each villain is fully illustrated and comes complete with optional things like powers, skills, and disadvantages.

rpgitemversion: Dawn of the Artifacts: Dusk PDF Version
52766.name: Dawn of the Artifacts: Dusk
52766.description:
Publisher blurb:

Sixth World scholars have long hypothesized the cyclical nature of magic. For years corporations, collectors and other factions have spent fortunes hunting down surviving relics of this mythical age. The shadows whisper of lost lore and a secret history to the world. A privileged few have come into possession of ancient items of great power and mysterious purpose, artifacts from before recorded history. Now it’s your turn...

On the surface, the job seems simple: escort and assist Ms. Johnson as she follows the trail of a man across the globe. The target? An agent of the Atlantean Foundation tracking a priceless stolen artifact. And the trail? It leads to Lagos, the most dangerous sprawl on earth, where simply surviving the day can be a run in its own right. Add in the biggest black market auction of the century, a powerful African king, and a plethora of the biggest players in the artifacts trade, from the Atlantean Foundation to Aztechnology... well, welcome to the underside of the artifact business. If you survive, there’s more work a-coming... and maybe even some answers to your questions.

Dusk is the first in a series of interlinked adventures that will take the runners to the far corners of the globe on a quest to recover priceless artifacts. Exactly who wants these artifacts, and why, are questions the runners will have to discover for themselves...

rpgitemversion: The Talislanta Guidebook Soft Cover Version
52767.name: Talislanta Guidebook:  Rules and Campaign Guide
52767.description:
User Summary:
This core-rule book continues the Talislanta series, which is an alternative to D&D that unlike other systems and settings does not draw upon European mythology or rehash Tolkeinisms. It brought forward the time-line of the earlier editions and reworked the magical system. Characters are generated using a broad range of different archetypes based on the very different and unusal races that inhabit the world of Talislanta.

52768.name: Escape from Stronghold
52768.description:
From the back cover:

BREAKOUT!

Stronghold
Designed to hold the toughest supervillains in your campaign! This supplement contains full maps of the prison, individual cells, a cell designing system, exciting scenario outlines, and six new supervillains! This reusable supplement is a vital addition to your Champions campaign!

52769.name: Deathstroke
52769.description:
From the back of the book:

"The World Is In My Power"

DEATHSTROKE holds the secret of ultimate destruction! Only you can save the world from nuclear blackmail! Blast your way into new and exciting CHAMPIONS adventures with DEATHSTROKE.


Deathstroke is Adventure Number 3 for Champions

52770.name: The Great Super Villain Contest
52770.description:
From the back of the book:

WHO is the CRIMSON CLAW?

WHAT is the CRIMSON CLAW'S dread secret?

WHY has he gathered the most powerful villains alive in a deadly contest for the mighty EMERALD EYE OF AZOG?

WHERE do these dumb blurbs come from, anyway?


The Great Supervillain Contest is Adventure Number 4 for Champions.

rpgitemversion: Ironclads And Ether Flyers Soft Cover Version
52771.name: Ironclads And Ether Flyers
52771.description:
Aeronaval Warfare in the 19th Century

Miniatures rules for battles between seafaring battleships and aerial gunboats set in the Space: 1889 universe.

Includes combat rules, scenarios and fleet directories for 34 nations.

52772.name: Moria
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
52772.description:
From the back of the box:

"The halls of Khazad-dûm once rang with the pounding hammers and singing voices of Durin's Folk, the greatest of the Dwarven clans. But that wsa long ago, before the Dwarves, in their avaricious hunt for new veins of mithril, awakened the Balrog who lay slumbering beneath the Misty Mountains.

Today, the halls of what is now known as Moria echo with the sounds of the Shadow - the tramping of booted Orc-feet and the cracks of the Balrog's fiery whip. This massive underground complex, which extends for many miles beneath the mountains, is filled with treasures untold and horrors unnamed. Only the most determined of heroes - or the most desperate - dare brave its endless halls and deeps.

Moria includes:

- Dwarves of Middle-earth: Seven Houses of the Khazâd, a 32 page book that provides copious background information on the history of the Dwarves of Middle-earth, including many new background packages and other character creation information pertaining to Dwarves.

- Khazad-dûm: The Delving of Durin's Folk, a 96 page guide to Moria itself, complete with elaborate descriptions of Moria, its environs, its history, and its denizens, including numerous adventure hooks and seeds.

- A unique system of sixteen map tiles that allow the Narrator to expand the physical scope of Moria without limits.

- Two large poster maps that depict several of Moria's great halls and deeps, as well as the environs and the surrounding wilderness, in more extensive detail."

52773.name: Poseidon
52773.description:
From the back cover:

Water, water everywhere...

The oceans of Poseidon hold many dark secrets. Only through courage and cunning will these secrets be revealed.

Those who succeed will find great power within their grasp.

Those who fail...

... will find a watery grave within the crushing jaws of the perfect killing machine!

rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
52774.name: Helm's Deep
52774.description:
From the back of the book:

"A fortress out of legend...

Helm's Deep, the legendary mountain fastness of the Rohirrim, is described within the pages of this sourcebook in unprecedented depth. Join Helm Hammerhand's brave warriors atop the mighty Deeping Wall, launch a valiant sortie against Orc-attackers, or explore the majesty of the Glittering Caves of Aglarond, where even the most jaded Dwarves have witnessed beauty beyond description. What's more, you can plot your heroes momentous campaigns with new rules for epic battles that take clashes between troops, companies, and entire hosts of soldiers to exciting new levels. Helm's Deep presents an absolute wealth of information for Narrators, players, and J.R.R. Tolkien fans alike.

Helm's Deep includes:

- More than four centuries of history and background, from the discovery of the Glittering Caves by the Dúnedain to Théoden King's decisive victory over the forces of Saruman during the War of the Ring.

- Statistics and background detailing the denizens of Helm's Deep, from the Master of the Westfold to the farmers of the Deeping Coomb.

- Ten detailed maps of Helm's Deep and its environs, including the Deeping Coomb, the Hornburg fortifications, and the Glittering Caves of Aglarond.

- A new mass combat system for The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying game featuring abstract and tactical rules, over two dozen sample units, 20 battle manoeuvres, and options for integrating your chronicle's heroes into the action."

52775.name: D6 Adventure Rulebook
rpgissuearticle: Into the Temple of the Hungry Star!
52775.description:
From the back of the book:

"A mad scientist needs only one more part to complete his doomsday device and you've been hired to protect it ...

As part of a covert operations team, you need to infiltrate a government embassy and retrieve important files ....

Along with a clairvoyant kid and a quirky mystic, you use your own extraordinary abilities to fight crime in the big city ...

Combining the best of over 15 years of D6 System design, D6 Adventure Rulebook provides you with the basics for playing in a wide range of modern settings from the wild West to the Near Future, including pulp action, espionage, and super heroes. You'll get everything you need to add the popular D6 System to your favorite setting, including:


three different yet compatible methods for creating characters - customizing preconstructed templates, using defined dice distribution limits, and distributing a pool of points;



over 80 character options (Disadvantages, Advantages, and Special Abilities) plus numerous variations of each that allow you to further customize your character;



your choice of relying on a Body Points or Wounds damage systems, both equally interchangeable with a single combat system;



detailed rules for psionics and magic (including numerous sample spells);



dozens of generic equipment and character examples to get you started in your adventures;



the essential rules separated from the optional rules, to allow you to decide on the level of complexity.


The accessible format includes an introduction to using the book and the system, a solo adventure to test out the rules, and "what's in this chapter" introductions to help you locate the information you need.

Also look for D6 Fantasy Rulebook and D6 Space Rulebook. Each book has attributes, skills, equipment, and character templates tailored to their specific genres, while using a game engine that's completely compatible with D6 Adventure.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

From the title page:

"Based on material by and with special thanks to Greg Farshtey, Douglas Kaufman, Fred Jandt, Peter Schweighofer, Bill Slavicsek, Bill Smith, Ed Stark, George R. Strayton, Teeuwynn Woodruff, and other D6 System, MasterBook, Shatterzone, and Torg contributors"

52776.name: D6 Space Rulebook
52776.description:
From the back of the book:

"My Dearest Heart,

I'm sorry I haven't written you soon.er I've had my pick of bounty jobs this season, and I've only now had some spare time as I make my way to a new system.
To let you know the type of events that I've been up against, at our first interstellar switch point pirates attacked us. Though a metaphysicist might have foreseen the danger, we didn't have one on board. Fortunately, a well placed shot from out cybernetically enhanced weapons officer efficiently finished the would-be thieves.
We only needed a few minor repairs to get us on our way. We made it to our destination without further incident, and a cyber-psy is bringing in the ship now. You and I will have to arrange to meet as soon as I've found out more about my next assignment - I could be heading to a megacorp-controlled planet or a frontier world. I'll let you know.!

Yours with live ...

P.S. Though you can't join my on my bounty hunting, I'm sending along a game that could help you get an idea of what I do. This books combines the best of 15 years of D6 System design, tailored to the science fictions genre. It cover all the basics for using the D6 System with you favorite settings.


Three different character creation methods - customizing pre-constructed templates, using defined dice distribution limits, and distributing a pool of points - allow each player to spend as much or as little time on making a character while being compatible with the method other players choose.



Over 80 character options (Disadvantages, Advantages, and Special Abilities), each with numerous variations - as well as a sampling of generic alien packages - allow players to further customize their characters.



You have the option of relying on a Body Points or Wounds damage system, both equally interchangeable with a single combat system.



You get quick rules for cybernetics, ship travel, ship design, and metaphysics (a form of psionic reality manipulation).



Dozens of generic equipment and character examples offer starting points for adding your own science fiction tech, aliens, and denizens to your adventures.



You get to decide on the level of complexity, with the essential rules separated from the optional rules.


The accessible format includes an introduction to using the book and the system, a solo adventure to test out the rules, and prefaces to each chapter that can help you locate the information you need.

Also look for D6 Fantasy Rulebook and D6 Adventure Rulebook, which cover attributes, skills, equipment, and character templates tailored to their specific genres, while using a game engine that's completely compatible with D6 Space.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

From the title page:

"Based on material by and with special thanks to Greg Farshtey, Douglas Kaufman, Fred Jandt, Peter Schweighofer, Bill Slavicsek, Bill Smith, Ed Stark, George R. Strayton, and other D6 System, MasterBook, Shatterzone, and Torg contributors"

52777.name: D6 Fantasy Rulebook
52777.description:
From the back of the book:

"It is a time for legends of heroes and heroes of legend, for powerful wizards and mysterious races. Search for treasure in long-forgotten mining tunnels or brave the open sea in a quest for new lands. You can make these tales and so much more happen with this book, which combines the best of over 15 years of D6 System design. It covers all the basics for using the popular D6 System game with your favorite classic fantasy setting.


You have the option to spend as much time as they'd like designing characters with one of three different character creation methods - customizing pre-constructed templates, using defined dice distribution limits, and distributing a pool of points - each compatible with the method other players choose.
You can customize your character with over 80 character options (Disadvantages, Advantages, and Special Abilities), each with numerous variations - as well as a sampling of generic fantasy race packages.
You have the option of relying on a Body Points of Wounds damage system, both equally interchangeable with a single combat system.
You can add magic and miracles to your campaigns - or leave them out.
You get dozens of generic equipment (including sailing ships) and character examples, which can serve as examples for adding your own magical weapons, inhuman monsters, and children in distress.
You get to decide on the level of complexity, with essential rules separated from the optional rules.


The accessible format includes an introduction to using the book and the system, a solo adventure to test out the rules, and prefaces to each chapter that can help you locate the information you need.

Also look for D6 Adventure Rulebook and D6 Space Rulebook, which cover attributes, skills, equipment, and character templates tailored to their specific genres, while using a game engine that's completely compatible with D6 Fantasy.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

From the title page:

"Based on material by and with special thanks to Greg Farshtey, Douglas Kaufman, Fred Jandt, Peter Schweighofer, Bill Slavicsek, Bill Smith, Ed Stark, George R. Strayton, Teeuwynn Woodruff, and other D6 System, MasterBook, Shatterzone, and Torg contributors"

52778.name: D6 Space Ships
52778.description:
From the back of the book:

"Whether flitting around to witness the galaxy's glory, delivering supplies to colonial worlds, or raining fiery death upon interstellar pirates, space adventures begin and end with the spaceship. And D6 Space Ships is your source for all these possibilities, and more.


A myriad of encounter ideas to inspire character goals and campaign plots



Game mechanics for stellar travel, law enforcement entanglements, effects of gravity, and ship combat



Ship design rules that include numerous room modules, several weapons with multiple variations, guidelines for determining scale, suggestions for adding character options to ships, and more



Over a dozen sample ships, including pictures of possible designs



A system for quickly generating generic planets



Information on converting the material for use with D6 Adventure games


This black-and-white book contains information useful for any science fiction campaign, but it requires the D6 Space Rulebook to get the most out of the game mechanics.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

rpgitemversion: Edição de Agosto de 2004 PDF version
52782.name: GURPS Lite (4th Edition)
52782.description:
"An Introduction to Roleplaying"

From the publisher's website:

GURPS Lite is a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules. It covers the essentials of character creation, combat, success rolls, adventuring, and game mastering for GURPS Fourth Edition.

The purpose of GURPS Lite is to help GMs bring new players into the game, without frightening them with the full GURPS Basic Set and a stack of worldbooks! With GURPS Lite, you can show your players just how simple GURPS really is.

User summary:

A 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules for Fourth Edition. Given away free by Steve Jackson Games, at conventions, via retailers and via the web in pdf form.

Enough rules are presented to create a basic GURPS character. The GURPS character point system is presented and players can assign their basic attributes, buy advantages and disadvantages and assign skill points. Finally, a basic list of equipment is available as well.

The basics of playing the game are discussed as well, including combat.

Targeted squarely at beginners at roleplaying, the booklet contains a glossary of basic roleplaying terms.

This was also used as the basis for the Powered by GURPS lines. GURPS Lite (3rd Edition) first appeared in May 1998. GURPS Lite (4th Edition) first appeared in 2004.

52783.name: Silver Lining
rpgseries: AGLA - Living Forgotten Realms Aglarond Regional Adventures
52783.description:
From the front cover of the adventure:

The commander of the Watchwall is looking for adventurers for a special mission into the Tannath Mountains. The Watchwall is always undermanned and the commander thinks he may have found some new recruits. But war, like politics, can make for strange bedfellows. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Aglarond for characters levels 1 – 4. This adventure is the beginning of both the “Invisible Road” and “Circle of Stones” Major Quests.

52784.name: Bifrost volume 1: Faerie
52784.description:
User description: "Book I of the three-volume Bifrost RPG rules set. This volume covers character creation, travel, equipment, illnesses and wounds, gods and goddesses, encounter tables, morale, weather, and character advancement.

Books II and III contain rules for creatures, combat, treasure, magic, demonology, magical items and 'Cosmic Magic.'"

Additional Information: Information is limited regarding this rare role-playing game.

Additional Acknowledgements:


South East London Wargames Group.
The Playtesters, Universities of Newcastle, Bath and East Anglia.
The nearest off-license and take-away..
All our helpers who have given lifts, inspiration, encouragement etc. especially Les and George.



Rules compiled: Orpington, Bath, Norwich, Newcastle, Athens, Exter, over the period June 1974 to February 1977.

52785.name: D6 Fantasy Locations
52785.description:
From the back of the book:

"Be sure to visit the Ahern Foothills and the nearby burrow village sometime.

I think it's north of the Izmerilia Forest, home to some Elves.

Or maybe it's west of the castle built by Lord Urdane of the Northlands.

Or perhaps it's south of the Perpetual Falling Land, with its intriguing stone circles.

Or it could be easy of the Dwarven mountain keep of Runiver.

Or you might have to travel through some treacherous straights, beyond the undersea city of Typhon.

Or ... why don't we go together and find out?

D6 Fantasy Locations provides more than 30 sample settlements, castles, and other places, each one with enough flavor to stand on its own while being sufficiently generic for use in nearly any fantasy campaign regardless of the system. You'll also find over 50 characters, four new spells, two new miracles, new artifacts and siege weapons, rules for navigating sea straights, game ideas for adding martial arts, and more. To round out this amazing collection, you'll get suggestions for designing your own settlements, fortresses, and maze-like creations, including a random settlement generator and a random dungeon maker.

You can download a preview of the D6 Fantasy Rulebook (which is required for the best understanding of the game mechanics), the design sheets from this book, fantasy character templates, and more at the West End Games web site, www.westendgames.com.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

52786.name: The Mind Masters
rpgissuearticle: A Few Great Modules to Play
52786.description:
From the back cover:

The first summons of the new season is called. Your name is drawn---you join the expedition. Your mission is to investigate rumors of a stockpile of ancient artifacts. Following a sketchy map, you cross the great river Twainway the day after leaving your settlement. Two days later, in unexplored wilderness, you encouner hostile nomad tribes. After finding traces of a lost expedition, you know your'e on the trail of something big. And then you find it, hidden down in a valley, forgotten and untouched since the Devastation. You were searching for a great store of artifacts. Here it is. The whole valley is an artifact!"

52787.name: Dallas: The Television Role-Playing Game
52787.description:
From the front of the box:

"All the drama and power, the wheeling and dealing, the loves and lives of tv's greatest family are yours to enact in this fun-filled, fast-playing game."

Boxed set includes:

- Rules booklet (includes three ready-to-play Original Episode scripts: "The Great Claim," "Sweet Oil," and "Down along the Coast")
- Scriptwriter's Guide
- 56 Character cards
- 9 Character sheets
- 1 Director's reference sheet
- 2 six-sided dice
- Game box

52788.name: Beta Principle
52788.description:
From the back cover:

In the lands to the south, young people are disappearing daily. No one knows where they are being taken, or why. Rumors abound of a New Beast, a Nwayvo Beestya, and of hordes of nos'erat which are terrorizing the humans and animals alike.

Also to the south is the Nameless City to which your group must travel, in search of relics of the Ancients. You are on a glory quest, one of the highest honors in the land. The fate or your people is in your hands. Is it worth the risk to combat this New Beast, knowing your original mission might remain unfulfilled? Or is your band tough enough to do it all?

Take your aid where you may find it, friends."

52789.name: Crossroads
rpgissuearticle: Role-Playing Reviews - Freshening up your fantasy campagins with unconventional characters
52789.description:
"Modern Mythic Role Playing"

Characters are Eternals, mortals chosen by a Tempus to fight in the Eternal War (good versus evil). Character types include Sentinels (protectors and shepherds of humanity) and Defilers (with various evil goals).

The default setting is modern day Seattle. Rules (and emphasis) are given on running an Epilogue for characters who die, which includes the appropriate afterlife.

From the back cover:

"So then I'm immortal?" Jade asked.
"I'm afraid not. You can die like any other human. The difference is that you've been set apart from the rest of humanity. Aided by the Tempus, your essence hides you from the prying eyes of mortals. Even as we speak, computers are losing your files. You will quickly find that if someone looks for you, you simply don't exist," Covell answered.
"What about my job?" Jade asked.
"Most of the Eternals leave their jobs and their friends and family."
"Why?" Jade asked.
"The Eternals who chose the pah to the celestial become Sentinls. The Eternals that slide towards the nefarious become Defilers. The Defilers, and other Children of the Dark One, don't give a rat's ass about non-combatants."
"So what do these Sentinels do?" she asked.
"As the cracks widen in the Great Barrier, more Children of the Dark One escape from Hell to attack humanity."
"And the Defilers try to break down the Barrier, right?" Jade asked.
"I think you're starting to see the big picture."

52790.name: Beneath Haunted Halls
52790.description:
This kit was available to retailers for the "Weekend in the Realms special event" on October 24-26, 2008. This was a promotional event to support the launch of Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, and unlike many special events was part of the Living Forgotten realms living campaign.
The included adventure was triple the normal RPGA adventure length with each of the three parts designed to run as a session and worth 4 RPGA reward points. The adventure was retired from RPGA-sanctioned play on October 26, 2008.

Some items were only in the physical and not PDF version of the kit. They are noted in the list of contained items:


The “Beneath Haunted Halls” adventure (and poster map if you have a physical kit), playable by LIVING FORGOTTEN REALMS characters levels 1-4.
A pack of DCI membership cards with signup forms (physical kits only).
A sample character for those that do not want to create their own character. Permission is granted to photocopy as necessary.
A FORGOTTEN REALMS trivia sheet. Photocopy this sheet and hand one to each of your participants.
A LIVING FORGOTTEN REALMS survey sheet. Photocopy this sheet and hand one to each of your participants.
The Weekend in the Realms Event Report form.


Notes:

Physical adventure is full color, PDF is greyscale only.
PDF version of the kit has adventure in one PDF and all the other documents in a second PDF

52791.name: F.R.E.E. Lancers
52791.description:
From the back cover:

BEGIN COMMUNICATION

To: All agents in all bureaus
From: F.R.E.E.Lancers, an independent agency
Re: The Future

Step into the future with F.R.E.E.Lancers source book, a wealth of detailed information for players and administrators, and a complete role-playing accessory for the TOP SECRET/S.I. game

Welcome to a future of backpack battlefield lasers, wrist-mounted self-propelled rockets, and a huge biped suits of superconductor-laced power armor. Welcome to a future of terrorists armed with nuclear devices, crime lords pushing pirated software, computer criminals and telepathic gangs.

Welcome to a future of cyborgs, powerful parabilities of the mind and body, computer-controlled cars, gravity-effect vehicles, agents and enemies beyond the ken and normal men.

Welcome to Chicago, 1998, on the eve of the Millennium. Welcome to the future of the F.R.E.E.Lancers.

Enter the TOP SECRET/SI game future world of adventure and intrigue. Corporate powers jostle with warring espionage agencies on the streets of a future Chicago, fighting for the greatest power of the future: information. The correct data, the important skills, can make you successful. Or rich. Or Dead.

The F.R.E.E.Lancers source book creates a futuristic campaign for TOP SECRET/SI game including new skills and devices, items on the leading edge of technology and directly from the street. Sections and used in the causes of good and evil.

The F.R.E.E.Lancers source book also contains the core of the F.R.E.E.Lancers team, to be used as a player characters, or NPCs: Refit, the remade, a patchwork of transplants held together by a nasty temperament; Dervish, the Arabic assassin from a cult of arcane combat; Captain Ares, the well-meaning would be super-powered hero; and Centaur, the cybernetic mixture of mortal man and equine steel.

These are your allies. they could be your enemies. They are streetwise natives of an alien world, a world only ten years from now.

Did you dare to answer the challenge of the F.R.E.E.Lancers?

END COMMUNICATION.

52792.name: Orion Rising
52792.description:
From the back cover:

"Complete information on all 12 Orion Foundation bureaus., their headquarter cities, actual headquarters, and more is now available to Orion Foundation with the necessary clearance."

52793.name: Star Wars Introductory Adventure Game
52793.description:
Match wits against an imperial probe droid. Fight your way out of a besieged Rebel Base. Gather your allies, supplies, and weapons while the Empire hunts you down with TIE fighters and walkers. Take on an Imperial Star Destroyer with a handful of starfighters and a heavily armed freighter. Liberate an entire planet from the Empire's tyranny.

You can do all this an more with the Star Wars Introductory Adventure Game.

This game has everything you need to create your own make-believe adventures in the Star Wars universe. You and your friends can pretend to be heroes fighting the Empire - all you need is this game and your imagination.
This game teaches you the rules while you play. One game booklet shows how to create and use your own customized Star Wars game character. You can choose to play a character type from the Star Wars films: smuggler, Wookiee, young Jedi, Mon Calamari, even a bounty hunter!
Another booklet teaches one person, the narrator, how to run other players through exciting Star Wars missions. It also includes an overview of the equipment, droids, creatures, starships, weapons, and vehicles in the Star Wars universe. An adventure book lets you and your friends play your very own Star Wars saga. Maps of popular locations, illustrated cards, and character stand-ups help you visualize the action and create your own adventures.

(Text from the back of the box)

52794.name: D6 Adventure Creatures
52794.description:
From the back of the book:

""You think of me as an unwanted twin,"
said the man who looked like my mirror.
Plucking my restraints with a knife, the doppelganger continued:
"I think the same of you."

From aliens to zebras, serial killers to ghosts, bears to evil clowns, this book contains details on over 150 different threats, encounters, and allies. Whether you want gargantuan animals or the mundane soldiers who'll fight them, ideas for new stories or inspiration for new character templates, D6 Adventure Creatures offers useful generic background information for any modern action campaign. The characteristics are written for D6 Adventure but are suitable for the entire D6 System line when using the included conversion notes.

You can download a free preview of the D6 Adventure Rulebook (highly recommended for the best understanding of the game mechanics), modern adventure character templates, and more at the West End Games Web site, www.westendgames.com.

One Die, Infinite Possibilities!"

52797.name: Lost Temple of the Fey Gods
rpgseries: AGLA - Living Forgotten Realms Aglarond Regional Adventures
52797.description:
From the front of the book:
Faeries, sprites, nymphs, and dryads – the fey creatures of Faerûn’s wild places are often dismissed as nuisances and pranksters. Those who truly understand the fey know that as with all things natural, there is a darker side to these creatures of fancy. Could a rash of stolen food and sleep dust traps point to a more sinister threat lurking on the wild side of reality? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Aglarond for characters levels 1-4.

This adventure retires from RPGA-sanctioned play on December 31, 2011.

52799.name: The Rotting Ruins of Galain
rpgseries: AKAN - Living Forgotten Realms Akanûl Regional Adventures
52799.description:
From the front of the adventure:
Amidst goblin raids originating from the ruined town of Galain, you are asked by a young genasi woman to locate her brother. Lost or deceased, it’s up to you to find him! A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Akanûl for characters levels 1-4.

This adventure retires from RPGA-sanctioned play on December 31, 2011

52803.name: Gary Gygax's Nation Builder
52803.description:
Gygaxian Fantasy Worlds Volume VI

From the back cover:

The crafting of an imaginary realm from which real entertainment will spring is a serious undertaking. Whatever its purpose, serving as the basis for role-playing game adventures or the setting of fictitious short stories or novels, the undertaking is a near Herculean one. The author of such a fantastic place must meet many demands or else whatever follows from his handiwork will be found wanting. This book is offered to the prospective creator of such a place in order to make the task of forming a nation from the stuff of make-believe a structured one, and thus easier to manage.

Nation Builder's primary focus is on the political, social and economic entities that comprise states in both modern realistic and fantastic settings. Each subject is supported with an ongoing series of detailed examples and miniature case studies, so that Nation Builder can serve as both a guide to creating campaign settings and a ready-made sourcebook and sample milieu for writers, designers and the like.

52804.name: Waterdeep
52804.description:
From the back cover:

Waterdeep is the third of a three-part series of adventures for the AD&D 2nd Edition role-playing game, but can also stand alone. Set in the popular FORGOTTEN REALMS game world, this adventure is loosely based on Richard Awlinson's Waterdeep, the third novel in the Avatar Trilogy. This adventure is designed for four to six player characters of levels 6 to 9.

52805.name: Bastille Day
52805.description:
From the cover:
Ace netrunner Spider Murphy is missing, and Rache Bartmoss, the schizophrenic spiritual leader of the Eden Cabal, wants the characters to find out what she's up to. But, as happens with so many of Rache's little projects, things rapidly get out of hand.

When the cyberkids pick up the trail, they find the steel-shod bootprint of one of the most powerful organizations in the post-modern world, and the only way to contact Spider may be to walk into the maw of the ISA dragon. All they'll have to do is avoid detection, find Spider, organize outside help and build an army out of nothing for Bastille Day - the liberation of the disenfranchised from the clutches of the Corporate State

52806.name: MediaFront
52806.description:
From the cover:
Take back your TVs! 2027: The nation's populace is fed an unending stream of propaganda and psychological sedatives via the myriad forms of electronic entertainment which permeate ISA culture. Can the Cyberevolved break the iron grip the government has on the minds of the masses? Tune in and find out...

52807.name: VirtualFront
52807.description:
From the cover:
Occupied Cyberspace! 2027: Once, the Global Computer Net promised unparalleled data access to citizens from around the world. But now the ISA is here, and the Net is under martial law, with all movement rigidly controlled by government and corporate watchdogs. But they've made one mistake: they've pissed off Rache Bartmoss, dead netrunner par excellence, and he's revving up the CyberRevolution to do something about it...

52808.name: EcoFront
52808.description:
From the cover:
Warriors for Mother Earth. 2027: The world's skies are black with acidic smog, the lakes choked with toxic runoff, and the forests mulched under the treads of corporate bulldozers. Now, it's time to carry the fight back to the ravagers of our planet as only the Cybergeneration can! And if they don't win this one, there won't be anything left to lose...

52809.name: These Hallowed Halls
rpgseries: EAST - Living Forgotten Realms East Rift Regional Adventures
52809.description:
From the front of the Adventure:
The Crafty Kobold Salvage Company has fearlessly plumbed forgotten treasures from the depths of the earth for many years. Now the owner’s son and his expedition have gone missing and he needs adventurers of uncommon mettle to brave the dangers of the Underdark, find the lost explorers, and perhaps even unlock the ancient secrets of Lodestone Deep. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the East Rift for characters levels 1-4.

This adventure retires from RPGA-sanctioned play on December 31, 2011.

52810.name: GURPS Basic Set Deluxe Edition
rpgissuearticle: Extracts from Drustos's Diary: D&D, RQ, GURPS
52810.description:
User summary and info from the web site:

A boxed set of the first two books for GURPS Fourth Edition.

Contains:
GURPS Basic Set: Characters (Fourth Edition) and
GURPS Basic Set: Campaigns (Fourth Edition) in a slipcase
Both books come with dust jackets. Both books were bound in bonded leather with two-color foil stamping.

Finally, Characters was signed by Andrew Hackard, Steve Jackson, David Pulver and Sean Punch.

rpgseries: SPEC - Living Forgotten Realms Core Special Adventures
52811.name: Shades of the Zhentarim
52811.description:
This is a double length RPGA Living Forgotten Realms adventure designed for play over 8 rather than the regular 4 hours. The Core Special releases are designed to be slightly more challenging that regular RPGA adventures.

This adventures was available with a staggered release, initially only playable at specific gaming conventions before general release to RPGA players:

August 14, 2008 - Gen Con Indy
August 28, 2008 - Gen Con UK
August 29, 2008 - PAZ (Penny Arcade Expo)
September-October 2008 - other select conventions
January 1, 2009 - general release




From the front cover of the adventure:
Zhentil Keep is a city with a storied history, even if most of the tale is not fit for innocent ears. A mission to find the wayward son of a wealthy merchant leads deep into the secrets, deceptions, and brutal power on which the dreaded Zhentarim built their ominous keep.
