52954.name: Dungeon (Issue 6 - Jul 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Tortles of the Purple Sage - Part 1
52954.description:
Volume I number 6

Cover by Keith Parkinson

Issue quote:
"But do you really mean, Sir," said Peter, "that there could be other worlds -- all over the place, just around the corner, like that?
"Nothing is more probable," said the Professor, taking off his spectacles and beginning to polish them, while he muttered to himself, "I wonder what they do teach them at these schools."
-- Peter and the Professor, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, C.S. Lewis

52956.name: DragonQuest Gamesmaster's Screen
52956.description:
From the back of the GM Screen...

The DragonQuest Gamesmaster's Screen provides the gamesmaster with privacy and instant access to DragonQuest's most frequently consulted charts and tables. For the players, there is a copy of the Weapons Chart and associated charts and summaries.

User submission:
The screen is printed on cardstock in full color on 4 fold-out panels.

52960.name: Star Wars Sourcebook (Second Edition)
52960.description:
From the cover:
"Ever want to know how a lightsaber works, where the Twi'lek homeworld is, and how many TIE fighters are on a Star Destroyer?

The Star Wars Sourcebook can help you discover all the technical and natural wonders of the fantastic Star Wars saga. The Star Wars universe is filled with sleek starfighters that clash with kilometer-long Imperial Star Destroyers, armor-clad stormtroopers battling desperate Rebels, bizarre aliens, devastating weapons, amazing droids, courageous heroes and cunning villains. Stories, maps, charts and illustrations help explain how the Star Wars galaxy works: from lightsabers, the elegant Jedi weapon, to repulsorlifts. You'll also find plans for an X-Wing fighter, a Rebel base, a Imperial garrison, and the blueprints of the Millenium Falcon!

All game statistics have been updated to Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game, Second Edition"

52962.name: The Palace of Ontoncle: DragonQuest Adventure One
52962.description:
From the back of the book:

The Palace of Ontoncle is a fantasy role-playing adventure scenario that can be used in conjunction with SPI's DragonQuest. The gamesmaster uses this booklet to describe the missions for the players and to guide them through the palace of an evil magacian and his henchman.

52964.name: Lost Colony
52964.description:
From the back:
"Lost Colony(TM) is the third and final installment of the award-winning, best selling Deadlands(TM) setting."

52965.name: Blades: Immortal Steel
52965.description:
From the book:

"Blades is a campaign sourcebook for your Legacy game. In it you will find a location for characters to meet and interact with each other.... And beneath it all, you will find the secret potential of the Blades themselves -- Immortal swords for Immortal Wielders, shaped at the beginning of time, the ultimate weapons in the War of Ages."

52966.name: Dragon (Issue 209 - Sep 1994)
52966.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XIX, No. 4
Issue #209
September 1994

Cover by Alan Pollack.

"Cleric kits, spells -- and druids"

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

52967.name: Story Engine Universal Rules (Revised Edition)
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Most Innovative Game - Runner-Up
52967.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Any game. Any story.

You're holding the cutting edge of roleplaying rules. The Story Engine is designed top to bottom for story games without the vestiges of wargaming that shackle so many other "storytelling" games. We've included Story Bones, our free online introductory version of the rules to help you get started as quickly and easily as possible.

Story Engine uses relative instead of linear scales, fitting everything from Gothic settings and Film Noir to heroic stories of good and evil such as high fantasy and superheroes. The rules adapt seamlessly to any genre, giving you fluid, fun games that focus on the story and not the rules.

Action is resolved as whole scenes through a bidding process and players spend resources to increase their chances, turning crucial moments into dramatic scenes.

Story Engine is the second generation of the ground-breaking Hubris roleplaying rules. It can be used with any game world, setting or story. Story Engine includes two adventure scenarios, advice on running games, sample characters and more!

52968.name: The Blade of Allectus: DragonQuest Adventure Two
52968.description:
From the cover:

A philosopher king and his beautiful daughter inhabit a lonely island stalked by a fearsome curse and rich in hidden treasures. You and your party sail to a dangerous challenge in this great adventure from the world of DragonQuest.

52969.name: Monstrous Compendium Annual: Volume Two
52969.description:
From the back cover:

Back again, and better than ever! Virtually all the new AD&D game monsters that were published by TSR in 1994 have growled, burrowed, and slithered their way into this second release in a yearly series of MONSTROUS COMPENDIUM supplements.
More than 100 denizens of the land, sky, sea and...other places...are collected inside. Most of these creatures originally appeared in a specific AD&D campaign setting, but they've all been updated and edited so they can be used in any campaign.
This year's collection also features the return of the long out-of-print dinosaurs and pleistocene creatures, and includes general encounter tables for the MONSTROUS COMPENDIUM books.
This richly illustrated book is an essential addition to every Dungeon Master's library.

52971.name: The Enchanted Wood: DragonQuest Adventure Three
52971.description:
From the cover...

A super-adventure with six completely different starting points to enrich variability of play and duration. 21 Maps and Diagrams plus Character Illustrations.

52972.name: Sentinels: Mortal Enemies
52972.description:
From the back cover:

"The Sentinels are a group of 'monitors': mortal humans who know about Immortals and keep an eye on them. But the Sentinels are much worse than mere monitors. They are deadly hunters, devoted to the destruction of Immortals.

Sentinels: Mortal Enemies includes:

New NPCs! New weapons! A master weapon list for Legacy Adventures & adventure seeds!

Conversion notes for Fudge, Fuzion, and Action! System"

52973.name: Spelarbok
52973.description:
User Summary:

This players guide (spelarbok) contains more options and background information for all four character types. It reprints the four separate player books in one volume:

- Härskaren & Ättligen (Humans)
- Rebellen & Överlevaren (Mutant)
- Väktaren & Viduntret (Psi Mutant)
- Tjänaren & Underverket (Robot)

It also adds a new but short section with rules for character flaws.

52974.name: Tales of Gargentihr
rpgissuearticle: Role-Playing Reviews: Roll out the oddballs
52974.description:
From the back of the book:

"Real Fantasy

In 1492 two continents met and the humans known as Karro first sighted the New World. In the villages there they met a simple and peaceful people who greeted them as gods. From these bases the Karro explored and claimed their New Republic of Gevuria.

It is now 1585 and the Ha’esh villages have grown into pollution filled Karro towns; the Ha’esh relegated to second class citizens in their own land. The new Institutes of the Karro collide head on with the old guard of the Chuch, whilst the bordering realms of Khos-Tavar and Ja’Hall look on with growing apprehension at their swiftly expanding neighbour.

Into this turmoil come the Clondis, a secret society of adventurers from all walks of life; grizzled streetmen from the back alleys of Rol Katel, educated society men from the mighty capital of Treth and noble Channi, the holy warriors of the Ha’esh. The Clondis accept any who are bold enough into its ranks and turn away no task that it deems worthy.

Tales of Gargentihr

Gargentihr is a world far different from our own. The continents drift upon endless seas of silt whilst Sa-energy crackles overhead in the blackened skies. The continent of Agasha lies before you, awaiting discovery.

Gargentihr is a world both ancient and new. The Insitute of New Science explores the frontiers of technology, whilst the secret powers of the Ancients reign within the dark corners of Agasha. Man stands on the brink of a glorious new age of knowledge, but many would block his progress.

This strange world is finely detailed throughout the rules and plunges the players into an alien landscape ripe for exploration."

52975.name: Mit Mantel, Schwert und Zauberstab
52975.description:
Subtitled: "Regelverfeinerungen und Ergänzungen für das Schwarze Auge"

Comment from the official website:

This expansion was released prior to the "Abenteuer Basis-Spiel" (DSA3 core rules), thus officially as an expansion box for DSA2. Nevertheless it was designed to supplement DSA3 from the start.

From the back of the box:

"What is a hero's life like in Aventurien ? How does he grow up, what is his background ? What difference does it make if your father was an earl or a blacksmith ?

"Mit Mantel, Schwert und Zauberstab" answers those questions and in addition to that includes rules supplements and refinements. All talents as well as the battle system are explained in detail, new classes (hunter, mercenary, medico and many more) are being introduced.

This expansion is essential for every DSA-player."

The box contains:

- "Vom Kampf und von den Helden", 92 pages
- "Vom Leben in Aventurien", 52 pages
- Heldendokumente
- Spielleiterdokumente
- 4 colored tableaus

52976.name: Metaphysical Ninja Maniac Chainsaw Vitamin Junkies
52976.description:
From the back of the pamphlet:

"Read'n'Run (Thru the Outback) in less than 30 minutes!
We have seen the future - and it's enough to drive you MAD, Max!

It's the Next Week (or maybe later): the perfect time for this TWERPS Campaign Set of automotive antics, futuristic fire-fights and mutant mayhem, set in a 'bomb-boozled' post-holocaust future world. Society has collapsed, and bad sci-fi has taken its place!

This set includes new rules, new character pieces, new maps, 2 complete adventures PLUS enough adventure-seeds to sprout hundreds of scenarios to drive your players bloomin' crazy!
It's Outback to the Future, TWERPS style. G'day, Mute!

52977.name: War of Bugs
52977.description:
WAR OF BUGS is a step-by-step strategy board game for 2 or more players.

The main feature is that you can use everything to be the battlefield table, stairwell, park, living room and so on. Bugs will climb, jump, fly and fight amidst the landscape and stuff thrown around.
That's why the game is about bugs -they can get everywhere.

Now the game is absolutely free and works on «DOWNLOAD, PRINT & PLAY» principle.

* Players make moves by turn, trying to seize opponent's artifact
* Bugs crawl, climb, fly, jump, fight, seize and defend bases and artifacts
* Bases produce bugs

The goal is to defeat all opponents.
The player is defeated when the opponent's bug seizes his artifact.

52978.name: Starfleet Voyages
rpg: Star Trek: Adventure Gaming in the Final Frontier
52978.description:
From the box cover:

The Final Frontier holds Danger and Adventure for those who volunteer for STARFLEET VOYAGES!

A complete roleplaying system for interstellar adventure including a separate starship combat game, color counters, and special Gamescience HIGH IMPACT dice!

DETAILS

Released in 1982, "Starfleet Voyages" can be summed up in two ways:

1. It is the culmination of Michael Scott's work in the "Space Patrol" series -- Space Patrol (Gamescience, 1977), Star Trek Adventure Gaming in the Final Frontier (Heritage Models, 1978), Star Patrol (Gamescience, 1981), as well as the "Star Fleet Battle Manual" boardgame (Gamescience, 1977) he co-wrote with Lou Zocchi
2. It is an much-expanded, but unofficial and unlicensed new version of Star Trek: AGFF

This boxed set included:

- A 74 page rulebook split into two sections: Book 1 - The Landing Party, and Book 2 - Starflight
- Starship Record Sheets (24)
- Starfleet Character Record Sheets (16)
- Gamescience High Impact Dice (d4, d8, d12, d20 and 3d6)
- Starship Markers Sheet, featuring 20 ships and additional counters (the markers appear to be originally from the Star Fleet battle Manual and Alien Space games, with Trek ships thinly disguised, by hand and with marker, to appear non-infringing
- 3 slips of paper: two with last-minute errata, and one with additional instructions (inclduing ordering information)
- A publisher's information sheet on the game

52979.name: Octopussy
rpgissuearticle: Game Reviews - Octopussy & You Only Live Twice
52979.description:
From the back of the Box:

Udaipur, India. The City of Dreams.

BRIEFING: Somewhere in this opulent city, the mysterious tradesman known as Kamal Khan is bringing to fruition a plot that will throw the world into chaos. Elsewhere, in her island palace on Lake Pichola, the beautiful Octopussy is scheming to multiply her enormous store of priceless jewels. Meanwhile, on another continent, one of the great treasures of Tsarist Russia - the Faberge Egg - is being slowly transported by a deadly circus towards an unknown destination.

MISSION: As an agent of M.I.6, the British Secret Service, you must attempt to find the link between Kamal Khan, Octopussy, and the Faberge Egg. But your task is far from easy, and it could be lethal. Armed with a few pieces of special equipment from Q Branch - and your own natural resourcefulness - you must uncover and defeat an underworld plan of international import. For if you fail, the world could face destruction.

Content:

48-page Adventure
M.I.6 Agent's Briefing Dossier with 8 handouts
Full color folder with portfolio of all major NPCs

52982.name: Dr. No
52982.description:
From the back of the Box:

Welcome to the island of death!

BRIEFING: Something is terribly wrong on the island paradise of Jamaica. The always reliable M.I.6 Station head has failed to make his report and has since disappeared. What terrible secret is so important on Jamaica it is worth the risk of murdering an M.I.6 operative? All clues point to the existence of a mysterious figure unknown to the British Secret Service - someone called Dr. No. Where is Dr. No located, and could he prove a threat to the rest of the world?

MISSION: Against the backdrop of romance and intrigue in the Caribbean, you must discover the link between the missing Station head and Dr. No. Though your assignment sounds simple enough, you will find yourself in constant jeopardy as you seek to separate the lies and legends from the truth about Dr. No. Do you have the courage - and the intelligence - to unravel the mystery of Dr. No?

Contents:

Illustrated 48 page adventure
M.I.6 Agent's briefing folder with 8 handouts
A stand-up screen with maps for the adventure

52983.name: Ratkin
52983.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Memory is in my blood
the purity of the Wyld surges through me
I remember the names of my brethren
kept to the rhythm of my beating heart
I hear the screams of my ancestors
distant echoes from the War of Rage
I smell the exotic scents of the spirit world
memories of paradise... and exile
My skin shivers at the thought of our betrayal
the lies and falsehoods of the Age of Man
My nerves twitch, sensing the fury of the swarm
we breed an army to seek our revenge
What my ancestors have sensed, I can recall
from ancient gods, I hear the call to battle
For memory is in my blood.
- Gregor Flames-and-Shadows, Ratkin Twicher

Ratkin includes:

A long look at frenetic Ratkin society, from their earliest legends to their current social conventions
Details on the Ratkin aspects, as well as the four Freak aspects that push the bounds of reality
Complete character creation rules - aspects, Gifts, rites, fetishes, forms, Merits & Flaws, sample characters and more

52984.name: Dungeon (Issue 10 - Mar 1988)
52984.description:
Volume II number 4

Cover by Daniel Horne

Issue quote:
"Notwithstanding the beauty of this country of Faerie, in which we are, there is much that is wrong in it. If there are great splendors, there are corresponding horrors; heights and depths; beautiful women and awful fiends; noble men and weaklings. All a man has to do, is to better what he can."
--A nameless knight, Phantastes, George MacDonald

52985.name: Mindshadows
52985.description:
From the back of the book:

"On the distant island-continent of Naranjan, brave adventurers study the psychic arts under powerful gurus, battle treacherous yuan-ti in the depths of ancient dwarven ruins, and evade elven cannibal tribes in the tropical jungle. Third in the Mythic Vistas series from Green Ronin, Mindshadows blends the rich legends of Southwest Asia with furious martial arts action inspired by the Psionics Handbook.

The first true psionic setting for the d20 system, Mindshadows can be dropped easily into any existing campaign. From the decadent city-states of the Spice Coast, to the treacherous capital of the Sudarshan Empire, adventure awaits--for those brave enough to traverse this exotic land."

52986.name: Dungeon (Issue 21 - Jan 1990)
52986.description:
Volume IV number 3

Cover by Janet Aulisio

Issue quote:
"To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive."
--El Dorado, Robert Louis Stevenson

52987.name: Dungeon (Issue 40 - Mar 1993)
52987.description:
Volume VII number 4

Cover by Allan Pollack

Issue quote:
"Vain the ambition of kings
Who seek by trophies and dead things
To leave a living name behind
And weave but nets to catch the wind."
--John Webster, The Devil's Law Case

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

52988.name: You Only Live Twice
rpgissuearticle: Game Reviews - Octopussy & You Only Live Twice
52988.description:
From the back of the Box:

Where is the missing space lab and its cargo of death?

BRIEFING: A Soviet space laboratory has somehow dropped out of orbit and crashed into the Sea of Japan. Unknown to the rest of the world, an experiment aboard the lab has gone out of control. A deadly strain of virus has mutated inside the lab. If the lab is opened, the virus will escape and decimate the world's population. It is now a race against time to discover who has found the space lab... and to stop them from releasing a plague that will destroy civilization.

MISSION: Your search for the fallen space lab takes you through the exotic streets of Tokyo and to the outer islands of Japan. As your investigations proceed, you find there is far more to the mystery than an accident in space. Treachery and deceit await you at every turn. Finally, you must come face-to-face in a showdown to the death with the dreaded Japanese master assassin - the Ninja!

Contents:

56-page adventure book
M.I.6 Agent's briefing dossier with 8 handouts
A GM screen with map of Japan and layout of villain's lair

52989.name: Dungeon (Issue 39 - Jan 1993)
rpgissuearticle: The Fountain of Health - Map Insert
52989.description:
Volume VII number 3
Cover date incorrectly states January/February 1992.

Cover by Paul Jaquays

Issue quote:
"And he'll say, as he scratches himself with his claws, 'Well, the Theatre's certainly not what it was.'"
--T.S.Eliot, Gus: The Theatre Cat

52991.name: Depths of Despair
52991.description:
From the back of the book:

"The Depths of Despair(TM) is the first in a series of D20 System(TM) setting books featuring isolated and dangerous environments--"Hostile Climes"--that may be dropped into any fantasy campaign! Inside is a detailed setting featuring a city at the bottom of a whirlpool and the caverns beneath, new skills, feats, gear, prestige classes, monsters, and a complete adventure to drop into your campaign right away!"

Contributors note: Despite being labeled "first in a series," no additional Hostile Climes books were produced by Pinnacle.

52992.name: Maps of Middle Earth
rpgissuearticle: Roleplaying in the World ofThe Lord of the Rings
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
52992.description:
A collection of maps for the regions of Middle Earth featured in the Lord of the Rings:


East Gondor
West Gondor
Rohan
Eregion
Mordor
the Shire


The maps are fold-out posters on paper with a slight vellum feel. This boxed set also includes a 32 page booklet describing the geography, landmarks, people, and characters of each region, featuring art from the movies.

52993.name: Mega III, le jeu de rôle des messagers galactiques
rpgissuearticle: Il était une ou deux fois...
52993.description:
This item is only available in French.

Third incarnation of Mega, the "Jeu de rôle des messagers galactiques" allow players to delve in the a trans-dimensional universe where the Guild of the Galactic Messengers travels through space and parallel universes using a tetrahedron structure as a portal.

This is the core rule book that contains everything you need to play.

There are two version of the rules. The hardcover and the special issue version from Casus Belli. The rules content is the same in both (including all the typos). In addition, the hardcover contains erratas, a campaign "Le voleur d'Ygol" as well as more background on the universe.

52995.name: Understanding Traveller
52995.description:
User summary:
A free booklet meant to be handed out at game stores (the back cover has a "TRAVELLER is available from—" box) that describes the basics of role-playing games in general, Traveller in particular, and the current state of the Traveller line.

It has been re-released by Far Future Enterprises as a PDF file.

rpgseries: Steel Sqwire - Area of Effect Templates
52996.name: Straight Cone Package 30' Cone with 60' Extension
52996.description:
User Comments...

A set of three radius Area-of-Effect, (AoE), templates. These plastic coated wire templates can be used to simulate many common spells found in Dungeons & Dragons.

30' Cone
Shout
Fear

60' Cone
Detection Spells
Breath Weapons

Light weight and fits around miniatures so you can easily see which creatures are affected by spells and traps. These templates are used for determining cones off of the flat side of the origin square.

rpgseries: Steel Sqwire - Area of Effect Templates
52998.name: Diagonal Cone Package 30' Cone with 60' Extension
52998.description:
User Comments...

A set of three radius Area-of-Effect, (AoE), templates. These plastic coated wire templates can be used to simulate many common spells found in Dungeons & Dragons.

30’ Cone
Shout
Fear

60’ Cone
Dtection Spells
Breath Weapons

Light weight and fits around miniatures so you can easily see which creatures are affected by spells and traps. These templates are used for determining cones off of the corner of the origin square.

52999.name: Volume 1 - Core Rules
rpgissuearticle: Review: Chivalry and Sorcery: The Rebirth
52999.description:
From the back cover:

The journey into medieval roleplaying begins with this, the first of the new books comprising Chivalry and Sorcery: The Rebirth.
This volume contains the rules for character generation, the core game mechanics, skills, vocations for warriors, thieves, and adventurers, a comprehensive marketplace for characters to equip themseves and guidance for advancing your heroes in experience. Published in the heartlands of Brittain which have given rise to the legends of Ivanhoe and Robin Hood.
